Machine Learning: A subset of AI that enables systems to learn from data
Neural Network: Computing system inspired by biological neural networks
Deep Learning: ML technique using multiple layers of neural networks
Natural Language Processing: AI field focused on language understanding
Computer Vision: AI field enabling computers to interpret visual information
Algorithm: Step-by-step procedure for solving a problem
Training Data: Dataset used to teach a machine learning model
Unsupervised Learning: Learning from unlabeled data to find patterns
Reinforcement Learning: Learning through trial and error with rewards
Overfitting: Model performs well on training but poorly on new data
Underfitting: Model is too simple to capture data patterns
Feature: Individual measurable property used in predictions
Classification: Predicting which category something belongs to
Transformer: Neural network architecture using attention mechanisms
LLM: Large Language Model trained on vast text data
Fine-tuning: Adapting pre-trained model to specific task
Prompt Engineering: Crafting inputs to get desired AI outputs
Tokenization: Breaking text into smaller units for processing
Epoch: One complete pass through training dataset
Batch Size: Number of samples processed before model update
Learning Rate: Step size for model parameter updates
Backpropagation: Method for calculating gradients in neural networks
